contentrichtext.text: {{Unreferenced|date=December 2009}} {{Infobox single | Name = You're A Wonderful One | Background = khaki | Cover = | Artist = [[Marvin Gaye]] | Album = [[How Sweet It Is To Be Loved By You]] | B-side = | Released = April 1964 | Format = [[LP album|LP]] | Recorded = January 6, 1964; [[Hitsville, USA]]; [[Detroit, Michigan]] | Genre = [[Rhythm and blues|R&B]]/[[soul music|soul]]; [[rock and roll]] | Length = 2:45 | Label = [[Motown|Tamla]] | Writer = [[Holland–Dozier–Holland]] | Producer = [[Brian Holland]]<br>[[Lamont Dozier]] | Last single = "[[Can I Get a Witness]]"<br>(1963) | This single = "'''You're a Wonderful One'''"<br>(1964) | Next single = "[[Try It Baby]]"<br>(1964) }} '''"You're a Wonderful One"''' is a popular recording written by [[Holland–Dozier–Holland]] and recorded and released as a single by [[Marvin Gaye]], released in 1964 on the [[Motown|Tamla]] label. The song had the narrator praising his "wonderful one" for loving him and for "always (being) around" him. Gaye is helped along on this song by [[The Supremes]] on background. The group had earlier backed him on "[[Can I Get a Witness]]". Musically, [[The Funk Brothers]] took elements of Chuck Berry's "Memphis" single and incorporated it into the intro of this song. The song eventually charted at number fifteen on the pop charts and number three on the R&B singles chart. It was produced by [[Holland–Dozier–Holland]], who worked with Gaye on "Witness" and later "[[How Sweet It Is (To Be Loved By You)]]" by Gaye a few months later giving him his biggest success as a solo artist until "[[I Heard It Through the Grapevine]]" in 1968. ==Personnel== *[[Lead vocals]] by [[Marvin Gaye]] *[[Background vocals]] by [[The Supremes]] ([[Diana Ross]], [[Florence Ballard]] and [[Mary Wilson (singer)|Mary Wilson]]) *Instrumentation by [[The Funk Brothers]] ==External links== * {{MetroLyrics song|marvin-gaye|youre-a-wonderful-one}}<!-- Licensed lyrics provider --> {{Marvin Gaye}} {{Marvin Gaye singles}} {{DEFAULTSORT:You Are A Wonderful One}} [[Category:1964 singles]] [[Category:Marvin Gaye songs]] [[Category:Songs written by Holland–Dozier–Holland]] {{1960s-single-stub}}
